channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: DOJ investigating Fed's Cook over mortgage fraud
item.description: The Justice Department has launched a criminal investigation into Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook over whether she submitted fraudulent information...

item.title: Tariff instability and a break with China is hitting American companies hard, and homegrown manufacturer John Deere is no exception
item.description: Trump’s tariff policies are hitting John Deere’s customers hard.

item.title: Lose-lose: Even if the Supreme Court strikes down Trump’s tariffs, consumers likely wouldn’t see a dime from refunds
item.description: The Trump administration might balk at paying back the tariffs it’s collected.

item.title: As Trump pushes Supreme Court to uphold his tariffs, he signals trade deals will be defunct if he loses the case: ‘I guess we’d have to unwind them’
item.description: “If we don't win that case, our country is going to suffer so greatly, so greatly,” the president said on Wednesday.

item.title: CEO Of Surrogacy Firm Admits He Uses Fertility Tech To Avoid ‘Ugly’ Kids
item.description: 'Nobody wants an ugly kid,' Barrie Drewitt-Barlow said. 'Sometimes we get them, but we don’t always want them.'

item.title: After Attacking Trump For Criticizing Leftists’ Judicial Coup, Media Hype Rogue Judges’ Attacks On SCOTUS
item.description: Prepare for leftists who attacked Trump for criticizing rogue judges to celebrate rogue judges now attacking SCOTUS.

item.title: Authorities raided Streameast’s offices and shut down the largest illegal sports streaming platform that had over 1.6 billion visits in the last year
item.description: The network illegally streamed matches and games from Europe’s Premier League and Champions League, as well as those from the NFL, NBA, and MLB.

item.title: If You Look Closely, You Might See A Slight Difference In How Media Cover Trump’s Health Versus Biden’s
item.description: For legacy media, 'journalism' isn't about telling the truth. It’s about doing the best darn PR for Democrats they possibly can.

item.title: American Universities Are Schooling China on Authoritarian Tactics
item.description: The attempt to limit speech through peer pressure risks turning campuses into surveillance states.

item.title: Don’t Let Ticketmaster Turn Trump’s Reform into a Monopoly Shield
item.description: Real reform shouldn’t mean more central planning.

item.title: Tim Kaine Thinks You’re A Terrorist If You Believe Rights Come From God
item.description: The idea that rights come from God, rather than the state, is neither radical nor foreign. It is the foundational principle of the Republic.

item.title: Google Antitrust Ruling Gets It Right
item.description: The tech industry is simply too chaotic and fast-moving to permit aggressive antitrust action.

item.title: Keith Ellison's son to keep 6-figure Minneapolis councilmember salary during fellowship at Harvard
item.description: Minneapolis City Councilman Jeremiah Ellison is facing criticism for keeping his $110,000 salary while accepting a full-time paid Harvard fellowship.

item.title: Sliwa says Trump team isn't pressuring him to exit NYC mayor's race
item.description: Republican Curtis Sliwa on Thursday dismissed speculation that the Trump administration is pressing him to bow out of the New York mayoral race.
